review_title: Great opportunities for students to earn money towards their tuition and living costs. Not always ideal for future work.
job_title: in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Very easy to balance school life and work life if you are currently a student. Personal growth and experience can be obtained while still taking classes.
cons: Compensation is not great if you are trying to make more than just some extra spending money

review_title: Great Place to work; Company culture is ify
job_title: Administrative/Project Coordinator in Ann Arbor, MI

Great benefits
Opportunities to advance skills and professional development 
Easy to transition to another area in the University once you are hired
cons:
Company culture depends on where in the University you work
Resources are great but not really talked about 
Long, and tedious hiring process.

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Ann Arbor, MI

cons:
Winters can be harsh for those that are unaccustomed to the midwest.

Ann arbor is lovely, but it very much feels like a college integrated with a small town. This isn't a con for all, but I feel that it's easy to outgrow such a place.

review_title: A friendly place, with lots of nice people and good accomodations to work with
job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

Decentralized work mechanisms helps in you finding a lot of space for your own research.
Work-life balance is great - people work around your schedule
cons: Being the large university that it is, you might get lost as just one other person in the huge crowd of employees.

review_title: A good job experience for a working student with flexible hours.
job_title: Resident Advisor in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: There isn't much room for growth and development and the training becomes extremely repetitive after a while.

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: However, the salary is pretty mean and only 15 dollars per hour is provided. But it really provides you a very good chance to practice your programming skills.

job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Ann Arbor, MI

+ Some world class researchers and professors
+ Investments in infrastructure
+ Everything covered health insurance
cons:
- Too many students compared to the opportunities / space available
- Lots of inertia to collaborate
- Mixed bag of students: very few brilliant, few good, most just for the ride

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
1. Vast Opportunity
2. Highly Competitive
3. Diverse Intellect
4. Large Alumni Base
5. Excellent Job Placement
cons:
1. Limited Support Structure in Large Institution
2. Vast Student Base Limits Personalization
3. Scarce Academic Support
4. Homogenous Politically

job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Very little mentorship for masters students. Few classes for the "Robotics" degree title, and difficult to get into classes in other departments sometimes.

job_title: Study Group Leader in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Helps you stay current with the material. Low time comittment.
cons: Depending on how long ago you took course, it can be hard to follow the order of topics or the topics themselves, especially if there are new professors. Not very high pay, I think you can get more at the dining hall, but that probably isn't as resume building.

review_title: Research assistant for a faculty members rear h project. Mixed methods analysais and writing
job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Very flexible job and work environment. It worked for my available time commitment and gave me valuable experience in the research field
cons: This position does not have benefits but is made for students with other jobs and duties. It is project based and depends on the faculty

job_title: Post Doctoral Research Fellow in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Opportunity to work with some of the smartest undergraduate and graduate researchers as well as brilliant faculty members.
cons:
If you are not a fan of cold (like me), you will have a tough time in Ann Arbor.
The EECS building is struggling with a critical lack of space problem. I shared a mid-size office with 6 grad students.

review_title: Michigan Medicine is a great place to work
job_title: Director in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Benefits Good work culture. Freedom of thought. New ideas well received and supported . Very supportive of family.
Perfect work life balance
cons: Slow pace of change. Many employees are older so new ideas need a lot of support from leadership (which I have had) to bring new ideas to life.

review_title: Nothing bad to say, best job I've ever had
job_title: Student Services Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Wonderful place to work with a great culture
Cares about staff and treats us very well
Compensation and benefits are outstanding for higher education
cons: None - I got a job here after a decade in K-12 public education. This is by far the best job I've ever had.

job_title: Building Manager in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Wonderful place to work in. Staff were friendly and helpful. Flexible shifts to choose from, and they will never ask you to neglect academics for your job.
cons: A large institution with many working subdivisions mean that information might get sent the wrong way or get lost somewhere, so things can get a long time to get done with.

job_title: Desktop Support Specialist in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: There are some really great, smart people and you'll likely get to work with really cool technology. Benefits are very good
cons:
Pay is bad for many positions
Management has no clue what they are doing
Culture filled with harassment 
Punishment for speaking out when things are going wrong

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: CHEPS has a great, collaborative culture and is full of friendly people. With researchers from a wide range of disciplines, spanning undergrads to PhD holders, you can learn from everyone around you. In addition to working and meetings, there are many Lunch & Learns and social events to partake in.
cons: Restricted to U of M students.

job_title: Marketing and Communications Specialist in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: You rarely have to work more than 40 hours, great benefits, beautiful campus, reasonable amount of vacation and sick leave.
cons: Parking can be an issue (but not on North Campus), some people are burnt-out and it is hard to get them interested in new projects, the hours are not very flexible (my office is 8am-5pm).

job_title: Lab Manager in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: University of Michigan offers me very nice and comprehensive benefit package.  Access to lots of on-campus activities and events.
cons: The university is a non-profit institution so the salary it can offer may not be comparable to that of a equal position in industry.

job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Relatively generous stipend
$0 premium for good quality health care
Many opportunities for additional support through internal grants, etc.
cons: Obviously, nobody is getting rich here and more support would be appreciated considering the load that graduate students bear in terms of research and teaching (if a GSI), but relative to other schools it is quite generous.

review_title: Nice place to work while being a student.
job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Dearborn, MI
pros: Scholarship, besides GSRA work is all fun, and does not require 40 hours/week.
cons: As in most universities, everyone is relaxed and everything is slow. You may wait months before you will get the software or hardware you requested.

review_title: Serials/Microform is the best job I've ever had
job_title: Library Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
- Plenty of time to do other work
- Flexible schedules
- Relaxed, open environment
- Quiet, clean, air-conditioned
cons:
- Not amazing pay, but not terrible
- Short lunch breaks?
- Can't use laptops

review_title: Pay not equal to job duties, nurses are not empathic-I prefer St. Joes
job_title: Senior Administrative Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Great insurance benefits and the ability to change positions if desired.
cons: Parking is a huge problem and only seems to be getting worse

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: The opportunity to support a great learning and research institution. Benefits include generous paid time off, good health insurance, and retirement matching.
cons: The extremely decentralized organization and multilateral politics challenges any attempts at change. The higher education domain is approaching a disruptive inflection point. Compensation is below market value and advancement opportunities are rare.

job_title: Website Designer in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Pay won't be extremely high and a lot of times there won't be as much work given to you. You can get bored easily if you don't proactively look for more work.

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: 1. Ann Arbor is a good city for living. 2. The university has excellent research facilities (every expensive equipment open for research). 3. Lots of interdisciplinary cooperation.
cons: 1. Not every program is good. 2. Weather is so bad, especially in winter times. 3. No big cities near by, need to travel to Chicago quite often.

job_title: Tutor in Dearborn, MI
pros: flexible to your timings if you are studying too.
cons: Number of hours you get is totally dependent on people coming in. So you might good hours if you teach Math.

job_title: Advisor in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Excellent benefits, fun atmosphere surrounded by students, great campus location.
cons: Staff not considered as valued as the faculty.  Ideas and strategizing from staff not taken seriously.

review_title: Great place to work! Wonderful co-workers.

cons: It can be hard to initially get promoted depending on the department you are in.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

review_title: OK place to earn a degree, bad if you want to innovate change fields
job_title: GSRA in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Good funding. Bright students. Good courses.
cons: Cold weather, difficult to switch branches. Bad treatment from professors / politics.

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Lab could be more clean and other undergraduates like myself should have been more organized.

job_title: Registered Dietitian in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Poor work-life balance, poor management and communication. Very little room for advancement and responsibility. Poor distribution of responsibilities between members of the same department with the same job.

review_title: Depends on the department, working at Michigan can be great or can be a pain.
job_title: Math Tutor in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Working with students can be a pain, especially if the tutoring job is drop in. Also, the compensation is better as a private tutor.

review_title: My experience has been fantastic working as a student researcher.
job_title: Student Researcher in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Best is about the collaborativeness of the students and the open-nesso of the professors.
cons: I cannot think of a con for working at the university. Best university in the world. Go Blue!

review_title: Great working with people with a variety of experience.
job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Not always the most attention to help with projects. Lab can get busy with multiple projects and one can get pushed back a bit.

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Ann Arbor, MI

review_title: Had a great time and made a bit of money
job_title: Guide in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Got to meet with a lot of faculty and staff
Got to see buildings I'd never been to before
Got to pick my own schedule
cons: Wasn't as organized as it could have been, but that's to be expected with any sort of migration like we were going through.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Budgets are getting tighter, so some graduate students are having to take on more teaching responsibilities for the same amount of financial support.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Ypsilanti, MI

job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Great people, excited about science and ready to help you and discuss math with you
Research is active and serious
Lots of interesting seminars, wide choise of specializations
Very good insurance
cons:
Lots of teaching, 20 hrs per week for real
Offices are without windows and maintenance could be better
Ann Arbor is a VERY small town

job_title: In-Office Phlebotomist in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Advancement and opportunities the atmosphere is great the co workers are also great love love love love love love it and would recommend others to try to work here as well.
cons: Parking is a headache. And waiting o s the shuttles are a pain ... Othet then thst I have no complaintd

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Ann Arbor, MI

review_title: Held in high esteem for a reason. Will produce deliverables at a pace not sustainable for the long term.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Production Coordinator in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Desk Job in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

review_title: Great place to work, excellent benefits!!
job_title: Research Area Specialist Associate in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: the "glacial pace"  - but even that you get used to. Only four stars because when my project was defunded, I lost my job and no luck finding a new one!

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: no real time management, personal management, project management. You can basically do whatever you want in a PhD as long as your advisor is old, has a lot of money, or thinks youre worthless.
cons: Unless I did it by myself on my own free time (which I was discouraged from doing because my free time should be spent working because Im a doctoral student) there is no career development opportunities. You get paid very little. No work life balance. My PI was horrible.

job_title: Customer Relations Analyst in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
People are very nice, and management is friendly.
Great benefits and emphasis on work-life balance
cons: Lack of career development, bureaucratic and slow to change, hiring process is slow

job_title: Research Assistant Professor in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Researh scientists are not well supported for their research or work. They are generally regard as second class citizens that do not make it to tenure track by the managment.

job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

review_title: I have worked here for 10 years and it's a hard place to leave. Great work environment
job_title: Associate Director in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Flexibility, ability to be creative, working with open-minded, competent colleagues across disciplines and departments; hardworking and dedicated students.
cons: Salary and promotions; some areas could use more/better financial resources for development.

review_title: Great place to work if you want a constant.
job_title: Business Systems Analyst in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Great work life balance and they have an excellent 401k program as well as medical benefits. 
when I left I was getting 6.5 weeks of sick and vacation time. don't find that very often anymore.
cons: due to the size of the organization they are slow to change.

review_title: One of the best engineering/research colleges
job_title: Senior Research Fellow in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Good working environment, good facilities, smart colleagues, best college town in US, good work/life balance in general

job_title: Part-time Instructor in Southfield, MI
pros: Share vision to prepare a more diverse body of students for an education at the University of Michigan.
cons: As of now, none.   However, I am only a subset of a subset, so I do not know the actual environment or day-to-day operations. My perception may be from behind rose-colored lenses.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Great benefits, excellent people, flexible working hours, great location, challenging work, at the end the degree is prestigious

job_title: Health and Wellness Coordinator in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Interesting work, decent pay, great benefits including a 10% 401k match, managers care about work-life balance, lots of flexibility and excellent co-workers.
cons: As with any large institution, things can take a long time to get done with many people involved.

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Ann Arbor is a great city to live.  It is not too busy, but still have the city functionality.  People are generally nice. Great colleagues to work with. Everyone is open-minded and willing to help each other.

job_title: Office Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: When I graduated, I was hoping to maybe find a full time job there, but no one was able to help me out.

job_title: Office Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: The people make it a great experience. If you ask for help, they will always try to lend you a hand. Overall, it is an enjoyable experience. A plus to working half-time is that the times are rather flexible.
cons: Sometimes the work can be tedious or repetitive, but it is still manageable.

review_title: Pretty standard in terms of PhD researcher career
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: As a graduate researcher, no union protections. No work life balance. However, that is also expected from being a graduate research assistant working on a phd.

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

review_title: Great graduate school with many talented people
job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
Has a competitive research program.
Meet many talented people and learn from them.
Good balance of people with all backgrounds.
Ann Arbor is a nice town.
Many cultural events.
cons:
Not competitive enough compared to other top ranked schools.
Location is not convenient for job hunting.
Summer could be a little hot and humid.

job_title: in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Midwest location isn't surrounded by any big biotech/pharma or even small size chemical company. Expect to leave Ann Arbor for long term career.

job_title: Research Associate in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: it's not exactly what i'm trying to do with my life at the moment, but that's really not their fault

job_title: Research Computing Specialist in Ann Arbor, MI
pros:
+ Great workplace.
+ Great city.
+ Great perks.
+ Great community.
+ Great Co-workers
cons:
- Promotions? Forget about it.
- Bonuses are a joke.
- Ancient job titles not remotely relevant to my work.
- So much red tape!

job_title: Graduate Student Instructor in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: They worked around my school schedule and I worked with a lot of like-minded students!
cons: Management tends to be rude, some are good and some are bad. Just be you and don't let them ruin you.

job_title: Recorder II in Flint, MI

cons: I don't really see the cons. I'm a very positive person and can find something good in anything.  I see the cup as half full.

job_title: Director in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: As with any large institution there will be pockets where change is needed.

job_title: Student Coordinator in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Not really any. Working at victors you sometimes had to deal with bad customers. Other than that not really any complaints

job_title: Rdh in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: CAEN in Ann Arbor, MI

review_title: Easy job, great benefits, attendance matters, low pay
job_title: Patient Service Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Campus Day Leader in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Graduate Student Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Research Investigator in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Laboratory Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Temporary Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: IT Worker in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Software Engineer in Ann Arbor, MI
pros: Community atmosphere that is relatively relaxed and accommodating.  Wide variety of cross training and professional development.   Exce
cons: Pay is not going to match industry.  Traffic around the University can be heavy, so not a great commute if you don't live nearby in Ann Arbor.

job_title: Admin Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI

cons: Favoritism, mid-level managers on a power trip, no training, mistakes are punished, agism and racism are rampant, doctors are arrogant and demeaning and administrators are worse.  Don't, just don't work here.

job_title: Lecturer in Ann Arbor, MI

job_title: Research Assistant in Ann Arbor, MI
